column4: hello, a question regarding saving oo Writer files: I have put some small clip art stuff into my file. Will it be saved inside the file?
hello, if i give my windows os using colleagues an open office file, will they be able to convert it?
hello, if i give my windows-using colleagues an open office file, will they be able to convert it?
why dont you save the file as .doc
because i lose some of the important formatting.
maybe save as PDF
if i save as pdf, can they edit the pdf if they so choose?
what type of formatting do you you lose when saving as .doc?
some table formatting. What I would like to have in the top of the column 2 goes to the bottom of column 1. In might be easier if you see the documents yourself. Would you like to see them?
I understand what you are talking about.  Do they have to edit the document?
well, i'd like them to make changes if they think it can be made any prettier.
have you actually open the document in word after saving with OOo?
no what i did was save the file as a doc. then i opened it in open office.
i don't have any msoffice apps on my computer.
if you have word, send it to your co-workers and see if they loose anything.  I would do it for you but I hate booting into windows :)
okay. i'll just send them the file in word .doc format and the reliable pdf format.
thanks for your ears.
you should also suggest for them to install OOo
i guess i could do that. whether they'll bother to, i doubt it. 8-)
OOo stands for Open Office what?
gotcha
